02-Sources/Books/The Society of Spectacle/The entire economy then became that the commodity had already shown itself to be - a process of quantitative development..md

02-Sources/Books/The Society of Spectacle/The fetishism of the commodity attains its ultimate fulfillment in the spectacle, where the perceptible world is replaced by a selection of images projected above it, yet also succeeds in making itself regarded as the perceptible par excellence..md

02-Sources/Books/The Society of Spectacle/The spectacle's basic practice is to incorporate into itself all of the fluid aspects of human activity so as to possess them in a congealed for, and to invert living values into purely abstract values..md

02-Sources/Books/The Society of Spectacle/When commodities dominate all of society, we stop relating to each other and to ourselves as living, creative beings â€” and start seeing everything, including ourselves, as things..md

02-Sources/Books/The Society of Spectacle/The Society of Spectacle.md

02-Sources/Books/The Society of Spectacle/Though alienated from what they produce, people now create every detail of their world with increasing power. Yet the closer their lives come to being their own creation, the more alienated they become from those lives..md

02-Sources/Books/The Society of Spectacle/The spectacle's social function is the concrete manufacture of alienation. Economic expansion consists primarily of the expansion of this particular sector of industrial production..md
02-Sources/Books/The Society of Spectacle/The spectator does not feel at home anywhere, because the spectacle is everywhere..md

02-Sources/Books/The Society of Spectacle/The alienation of the spectator works like this - the more he contemplates, the less he lives - the more he identifies with the dominant images of need, the less he understands his own life and desires..md

02-Sources/Books/The Society of Spectacle/Spectators are linked solely by their one-way relationship to the very center that keeps them isolated from each other. The spectacle thus reunites the separated, but it reunites them only in their separateness..md

02-Sources/Books/The Society of Spectacle/The abstractifying of all individual labor and the general abstractness of what is produced are perfectly reflected in the spectacle, whose manner of being concrete is precisely abstraction..md

02-Sources/Books/The Society of Spectacle/The goods that the spectacular system chooses to produce also serve it as weapons for constantly reinforcing the conditions that engender "lonely crowds". With ever-increasing concreteness the spectacle recreates its own presuppositions..md

02-Sources/Books/The Society of Spectacle/In the course of this development, all community and all critical awareness have disintegrated, and the forces that were able to grow by separating from each other have not yet been reunited..md

02-Sources/Books/The Society of Spectacle/The spectacle is an autonomously developing power, based on the increasing productivity resulting from an increasingly refined division of labor into parcelized gestures dictated by the independent movement of machines and an ever-expanding market..md
02-Sources/Books/The Society of Spectacle/The modern spectacle depicts what society could deliver, but in so doing it rigidly separates what is possible from what is permitted..md
02-Sources/Books/The Society of Spectacle/Separation is the alpha and omega of the spectacle..md

02-Sources/Books/The Society of Spectacle/The social separation reflected in the spectacle is inseparable from the modern state - that product of the social division of labor that is both the chief instrument of class rule and the concentrated expression of all social divisions..md

02-Sources/Books/The Society of Spectacle/If the administration of this society and all contact between people has become totally dependent on these means of instantaneous communication, it is because this "communication" is essentially unilateral..md

02-Sources/Books/The Society of Spectacle/The spectacle is not the inevitable consequence of some supposedly natural technological development. The society of the spectacle is a form that chooses its own technological content..md
02-Sources/Books/The Society of Spectacle/The fetishistic appearance of pure objectivity in spectacular relations conceals their true character as relations between people and between classes..md
